Registrar's Manual 2009

The following requirements shall be satisfied by the applicants before he/she is admitted to the programs offered by respective colleges or campuses.
Admission of Freshmen students. The following requirements shall be submitted by the applicants to the Office of the University Registrar for admission and registration:
● Notice of Admission issued by OSA ● Original copy Form 137 or form 138 ● Original Copy of Certification of Good Moral Character ● Results of Medical and Dental Examination
Admission of Transfer Students. Transfer Students from other schools and colleges/universities are required to submit the following:
● Notice of Admission issued by OSA ● Transcript of Records (Together with Description of courses) ● Honorables Dismissal/Transfer Credentials ● Certification of Good Moral Character by the Guidance Counselor/Dean from the
last school attended ● NBI or Police clearance
● Results of the interview and evaluation by the college Evaluation Committee
In case Transcript of Records from the school last attended is not available at the time of enrollment Certification of Grades or True Copy of Grades can be accepted by the College Registrar and or the university Registrar under temporary status.
Admission of Foreign students. Foreign students are required to:
● Submit an approved permit to study from the concerned embassy ● Pay a non-refundable student fee of $30.00
● Other Prescribe requirements/documents by the Bureau of Immigration for student Visa ● Submit a Certificate of English Proficiency from the Department of Languages and Humanities
Shifting to other Programs. Students who intend to shift to another University program must accomplish a prescribed form for the purpose to be approved by the Dean of the College where they want to shift to: not late than ten (10) working days before the start of the regular registration period. A copy of the approved application for shifting should be forwarded by the Dean concerned to the University Registrar's Office.
Lifted From the 2009 CvSU Registrar Manual

Students pursuing degree programs may be allowed to shift to non-degree programs upon approval of their application for shifting.
Students pursuing non-degree program may be allowed to shift to degree programs offered by the College after satisfying the following requirements except for ladderized programs:
● GPA of 2.0 or better; ● Submission of approved application form and other supporting documents; and ● PAssing the required entrance examination
Cross registration. Cross Registrants from other educational institutions should have a written permission from their school registrar to be presented by the CvSU registrar. The permit shall state the subject(s) and the total number of units the student is allowed to cross-register and that the University shall be the venue for the course to be registered.
For courses with prerequisites, the cross-registrant shall be required to present an authenticated proof of equivalency of course and description of the required course.
CvSU students who are planning to cross-register courses with other institutions should have a written permit from their College and the University Registrar's.
Students planning to cross-register in other University College or campus shall be allowed only under the following conditions:
● The course(s) to be cross-registered should have exactly the same description as the one being offered in the another college or campus where the student plan to cross-register; ● Must have written permit form their respective College Registrar and finally the University Registrar; and ● Students are allowed to cross-enroll a maximum of six(6) units only for the entire program.
Enrollment for Residency A student who registered the required six(6) units for thesis or its equivalent shall enroll another one unit, if he fails to defend his research. However, he shall only be required to enroll residence status if he has successfully defended his research but failed to submit the bound manuscript.
Lifted From the 2009 CvSU Registrar Manual

and other requirements for graduation. Furthermore, a student may enroll residency under the following conditions.
1. Completed all the academic requirements and completing thesis manuscript provided he/she had already enrolled six units and successfully defended the manuscript, Provided further, that completion will be done on the following semester. 2. No academic load but need to complete the grade of “INC” or remove the grade of “4.0” during the term. 3. Unfinished OJT or practicum of least ⅙ of the required number of hours services, provided no written report is to be submitted. 4. Completing written report or narrative report but had finished the required practise teaching 5. Enrolled in ROTC or National Service Training Program (NSTP) but no academic load. 6. Students who will register to other University for Valid reasons.
Enrollment for residency shall be made during the scheduled registration period.
